admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Project will
            support a set of core components from the government's
            emergency response program that will help meet immediate,
            incremental, returnee-induced needs for essential social
            services and physical infrastructure and to assist in
            returnees' integration into the economy by creating
            jobs associated with these expenditures.  The project will
            provide financing for the following components:  (a)
            provision of teaching/learning materials, classroom
            equipment and furniture, building materials/equipment for
            sanitary facilities, maintenance service, rental payments
            for space to serve as temporary classrooms, and salaries for
            additional teachers; (b) provision of urgently needed
            medical supplies and drugs, salaries for additional medical
            staff, and intensive maintenance services; (c) replacement
            of 300 buses, spare parts and workshop equipment; (d)
            expansion of water supply and sewerage facilities to meet
            estimated additional water demand; and (e) provision of
            urgently needed rehabilitation and maintenance for about 235
            km. of main roads between Azraq in northeast Jordan and Amman.
